lead_paragraph: RODZENKO--Michael. 94, of Bedford, NH, passed away peacefully with his loving family by his side on March 6, 2016. He was born in Bayonne, NJ, on September 14, 1921, a son of Michael and Anna (Lucas) Rodzenko, both Hungarian immigrants. Mike started college at Cooper Union in New York, NY, which was interrupted by his U.S. Navy service from 1942 to 1948. He resumed his education with graduate school at the University of Chicago earning a Master's degree in economics, a Master's degree in Hospital Administration from Northwestern, and a Master's degree in Public Health from Harvard University. Mike was joined in marriage with Joan McPherson in 1953. He began his career in hospital administration in 1954 at Philadelphia General Hospital and continued at Peter Bent Brigham Hospital, Boston, MA. Mike worked at Roswell Park Cancer Institute in Buffalo, NY, and concluded his career working 28 years at South Nassau Communities Hospital, Oceanside, NY, retiring in 1999. Mike enjoyed wood working, reading and collecting books. He was an ardent outdoorsman and a lifetime member of the Appalachian Mountain Club. Mike is survived by his loving wife of nearly 63 years, Joan; a son, Greg Rodzenko; and a daughter, Karen Rodzenko. Services: Calling hours will be held from 4 to 7pm on Tuesday, March 8, 2016 at Goodwin Funeral Home and Cremation Services, 607 Chestnut Street, Manchester, NH. A Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated at 10am on Wednesday, March 9, 2016, at St. Elizabeth Seton Catholic Parish, 190 Meetinghouse Road, Bedford, NH. Please visit www.goodwinfh.com to sign the online guestbook. 1/3
